top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 86, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gran Fondo Strade Bianche's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before March.
Gran Fondo Strade Bianche's Strade bianche (white roads), Compacted clay forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 86 miles.
76ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
6,560ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At Gran Fondo Strade Bianche, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gran Fondo Strade Bianche. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gran Fondo Strade Bianche, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on compacted earth/clay with crushed stones—the. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 86 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
6,560ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
The aerobic base that lets you ride compacted earth/clay with crushed stones—the at tempo for 86 miles without cracking. No shortcuts.

race_overlay.heat: March in Siena, Tuscany, Italy can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Gran Fondo Strade Bianche. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gran Fondo Strade Bianche’s 86 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gran Fondo Strade Bianche requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on compacted earth/clay with crushed stones—the famous 'strade bianche' to build confidence. Expect: strade bianche (white roads), compacted clay, paved roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 86 miles of compacted earth/clay with crushed stones—the famous 'strade bianche' in Siena, Tuscany, Italy.
